Event: Moving away from home and isolating oneself for three years, experiencing a long distance relationship that ended before the person moved back home, and struggling to make friends and connect with people after returning home. These events have led to feelings of loneliness, trust issues, obsessive behavior on social media, and a tendency to focus on the past rather than the present.
Post: "I've been feeling so lost and disconnected from the world. I moved away from home and spent three years in isolation, and now that I'm back, I can't seem to connect with anyone. My long-distance relationship ended before I even returned home, and now I'm left with nothing but my own thoughts. I find myself constantly scrolling through social media, comparing my life to others and feeling like I don't measure up. It's like I'm stuck in the past, unable to move forward. I don't know how to break free from this cycle of loneliness and negativity."

Event:
Intimidation at school

The main event in the passage is the intimidation experienced by the narrator at school, specifically from two famous volleyball players who tried to bully him. They would laugh at anything he did, start rumors, and shout insults to make sure others heard them. The narrator remained indifferent, which made their behavior worse, and they even got physical. The passage highlights the limited empathy of most people, as only one person reacted with genuine empathy, while the rest watched anxiously awaiting what would happen next. The narrator learned that nearly everyone in their life is not worth their time and energy, and they need to be respectful of their entourage. They also realized that they are the strong one and have the self-control to overcome these situations. The passage concludes by inviting readers to share their stories and experiences.
Post: "I'm so done with this school. I get bullied every day by those two volleyball players. They think they're so cool, but they're just insecure losers. I try to ignore them, but it's hard when they're constantly laughing at me and spreading rumors. Even the teachers don't care. It's like, hello, don't you see what's going on? I'm starting to feel like I'm all alone in this. #bullying #school #intimidation"

Why can't I just be normal and happy like everyone else?"
